name: Trash, Cash, Repeat
description: Main Idea is use Diesel(s) to get lots of programs to use Free Coding Contract and then Levy AR Lab Access when the stack gets low.

name: Jinteki Shell
description: Guard Central Severs, trick out runner with multiple Remote Servers randomly trapped.

name: Dedicated Response Team  - Second Thoughts
description:
Crazy idea:

1. Tag with hunter, shadow, data raven, and snare
2. Play tagging ice on R&D and HQ, and ETR ice on HQ and remotes
3. In remotes, use off the grid to protect Dedicated response team or agendas
4. Let snares stack in hand.

Remember that Off the grid doesnt need ice if they cant get into HQ.

Its trying to flatline, but not always with scorched. Quite a few permutations of six damage:

2x snare
1x snare + DRT + Cleaners
2x DRT + Cleaners
1x DRT + Scorched
2x Scorched
Cleaners + PSF

Etc etc.

name: Cloak and Dagger "Kit"
description: First attempt at playing with the Kit identity. Somewhat new to the game. Second attempt at building a runner deck. I'd be very grateful for any tips or advice. I am limited to the 1 core set and creation and control.Thanks!

name: Hipster Kit and Her Fixie Rig
description: Looking to deep dive R&D on this one. It seems like a good smart run deck but i have yet to test it. Also Kit seems to me like a runner that wants to hit the ground on the bounce. I have a Kit parasite/sucker deck and it doesn't stand to the Weyland T&B or Haas competitive decks. Any thoughts on running Kit would be great. I like the concept of this runner.

name: Slowdown
description:
This is a deck experiment at thwarting fast advance decks. The main cards that facilitate this are, of course, The Source, but also Imps to be able to trash crucial combo pieces such as Trick of Lights of Biotic Labour. Whizzard himself on the other hand can make short work of Sansans along with the usual suspects of Howard, Bernice Mai and Ash.

The idea is to play the source down when you see an unadvanced card, which you're not sure it's worth running. If the corp advances it, either infiltrate it, or if certain is an agenda, stimhack into it.

Scavenge are there to recurse the Imps for free and even re-use the same Imp on the same turn. They help make HQ runs much more painful for the corp.

Medium is a alt-win condition, in case remotes are locked down tighter than we can afford.

This deck runs Dysons instead of Grimoire, as I found its ability does not come very handy while Dysons can provide link which can come in handy against chear tracers like caduceus or shadow when your mimic is missing.
